title.narrative: Bettering the Livelihoods of “Ai-Dar” ASC Members through Livestock Restoration, Education, and Community Enrichment in Denezhnykove Village, Luhansk

description.narrative: Within the framework of the project, 15 highly-productive pregnant heifers of a Ukrainian milk cattle breed (Red and White, Black and White or Red-Steppe) will be provided to members of the Ai-Dar Agricultural Service Cooperative (ASC). The ASC will implement the project, which will help facilitate the growth and development of dairy and meat product sales in the village, improving the livelihoods of the Ai-Dar ASC members. Members of the cooperative have already received equipment and materials for milk collection (milk truck and scanner from the State Support Program for Cooperative Development), valued at $45,000. The cooperative also expects to receive additional equipment for land cultivation, procurement of feed and other activities connected to the work of a milk cooperative. As a result, the income of project participants will increase by an expected minimum of 25 percent, and their nutrition will substantially improve. The project participants who do not receive heifers will use the equipment obtained by the cooperative and will receive training that will help them better manage their family land plots, market their produce, care for their animals, obtain more milk and ensure that they earn the most profit possible. This project will impact at least 330 families directly, covering the entire community of Denezhnykove, as well as neighboring communities. The project will also significantly impact many aspects of community life, including gender equity, agroecology, and enterprise development.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
